poem:
The Clock's Discontent  

no, they echo,  
cool shadows against  
the long light of history—  
the clock ticks,  
unmoved by the  
weight of chains  
once forged.   
yet in quiet leaves,  
a whisper  
of repair persists—  
a green courage  
to press the soil,  
turn the time  
that will not turn.
